page.title: 07Communications in Cowlinge
page.content: The majority of homes in Cowlinge are on the telephone, and there is a public telephone box in the centre of the village. There are two post boxes from which collections are made twice daily, and postal deliveries are made twice a day in the main street and once a day to the outlaying houses. These are made by postal van from the main post office in Newmarket. Communication within the village is spread rapidly by word of mouth and there is also a bimonthly sheet 'The Cowlinge Courier' giving past and forthcoming events.This is run by residents of the village.
